thread.title: Doris Day is trending in the UK as Storm Doris blows on – #DorisDay | Metro News
thread.title_full: Doris Day is trending in the UK as Storm Doris blows on – #DorisDay | Metro News

author: Charles White
title: Doris Day is trending in the UK as Storm Doris blows on – #DorisDay | Metro News
text:
A lot of people are blaming Doris Day for the bad weather Charles White Thursday 23 Feb 2017 1:34 pm Doris Day is whipping up a storm on social media (Picture: Everett/REX Shutterstock) 
The American star, Doris Day, is whipping up a storm on Twitter as users react to Storm Doris in the UK. 
Cold weather and harsh winds left many drawing comparisons with the star’s hit song The Windy City. Teenager died after branch snapped and he hit head on submerged rock 
In her iconic film Calamity Jane the 92-year-old actress sang: ‘I just blew in from the Windy City. The Windy City is mighty pretty. But they ain’t got what we got, no sir.’ 
For some reason, a lot of people in the UK appear to be a little confused, thinking Doris Day might be linked to the latest bout of bad weather. 
The woman dressed as a cowgirl wants you to stay safe 🎶 I just blew in from the Windy City,The Windy City is mighty pretty.. 🎶 
Don't get blown away! 🌬 pic.twitter.com/s6jhIT8bOH 
Don’t let any calamity happen when you’re out Storm🍃 🌾🌪🌾Doris approaches the UK. 🌪🌾🍃🌪Doris Day as Calamity Jane-unrelated but hey ho! #stormdoris #DorisDay 🌾🍃 pic.twitter.com/Gpdz9oP7eU 
— Chris Gibson (@Cjgibson7Gibson) February 21, 2017 
Some blamed the star for the miserable weather I wish #DorisDay would push off….it's mad weather in the UK today! #QueSeraSera 
— Al Sarpong (@albsar1970) February 23, 2017 
It’s not just Beliebers who rush to defend their favourite singer Don't blame this lovely lady for what happens tomorrow #DorisDay pic.twitter.com/q9GcclkN5E 
— Matthew Chattle (@MatthewChattle) February 22, 2017 
This serene tweet found comfort in the 50s classic
